data.text: RT @paivyttallqvist: So long and thanks for all the flights! Our OH-LVA has been flown to Cotswold UK for recycling, after 32 710 flights.…

When an aircraft reaches the end of its design service goal, Finnair makes sure that as many of its parts as possible are reused or recycled. Our latest aircraft to start its afterlife is an Airbus A319-112, which has undertaken a massive 32,710 flights. https://t.co/oktoln1JvN

We are bringing our famous signature blueberry juice drink to travel-thirsty grounded customers. The blueberry juice drink will be on sale for fans at 300 K-group grocery stores in Finland from December. Read more: https://t.co/AWAATQV1Om https://t.co/GRoD3yCv0N

data.text: The Finnish winter with high humidity and snow presents a challenge for long-term parking of aircraft, while the climate in Southern France is more favourable. Four Finnair A330 wide-body aircraft will be flown to Tarbes, France for the winter. https://t.co/zjY7zFCgxX
RT @Anne_Larilahti: Aviation needs to find a pathway to meet the Paris Agreement goals as an industry, not only individual companies. @Finn…

data.text: Think pilots make flight plans? Think again! At Finnair, there’s a team of dedicated flight planners that plan each flight meticulously, allowing pilots to concentrate on the vital job of flying passengers and cargo from A to B safely. https://t.co/eqwOjea8Cg
RT @OjaJuha: Some insights and nice pictures from ⁦@Finnair⁩ Technical Operations during these challenging times. Preparing for coming wint…
Finnair wishes very happy birthday to our favourite Aussies! 100 years of aviation is an impressive feat. Congratulations and good luck for the next 100 years, @Qantas! https://t.co/QHIQ5H0FPo

data.text: When you buy Finnair Plus award points before 16 November, you will earn up to 100% bonus award points, as well as 25% bonus tier points on the total award point transaction. Learn more about this unique offer: https://t.co/aMLUFTxFCo https://t.co/IJdYOFx9Ok

New travel guidance for people travelling to China: You now need a negative coronavirus test result within 48hrs of departure. When transferring through Helsinki, you need a negative test result not only in your country of departure but also in Helsinki. https://t.co/Xqkj3VJTZ2

data.text: Our pilots are now using mobile EFB for their flights instead of PC devices fixed on the aircraft. The new EFB system runs on iPads, travels with the pilot and connects him/her to a variety of tools, such as flight planning, charts, manuals, and reporting, regardless of location. https://t.co/MhsS43R1k6

data.text: We are sorry that our customer service is congested at the moment. Do you have a question regarding a cancelled flight? We are cancelling the flights in phases starting from Nov and we’ll inform you personally if your flight has been affected. Read more: https://t.co/dxT82iConx https://t.co/92OGSFU9Kc
RT @kiviselg_sander: @Finnair took delivery of this beautiful A350-900 OH-LWA 5 years ago. What a beauty she is! Now Finnair operates 16 of…
RT @AlexInAir: A truly memorable A350 delivery flight from Toulouse to Helsinki. A great team, beautiful cabin & the start of a new chapter…
Exactly five years ago, we had the delivery of the first member of our Airbus A350 family. Since then, the family has grown to 16 members! ✈️ #FinnairA350 #feelfinnair https://t.co/nQd4jrbUCJ

Nĭ hăo Nanjing! Our service between Nanjing and Helsinki continues: As of  23rd of October (subject to government approval), we fly once a week from Helsinki to Nanjing and back. The flights will continue until 21st of March, 2021. https://t.co/mTBbpi1qoh
In September, Finnair carried 115,500 passengers, which is 91.0% less than in the corresponding period of 2019 and 40.1% less than in August 2020. https://t.co/PLoJUATHEB
RT @paivyttallqvist: Five years ago today we got our first #FinnairA350 home from Toulouse. After that, we saw growth, recruitments and new…
Finnair flies to 51 destinations in Europe and Asia in the winter, increases destinations for summer 2021. https://t.co/Eb2sJTSMeS

data.text: Operating cargo only flights on our modified A330’s is a whole new challenge to our cabin crew members! Our cabin crew member Kaisa flew from Shanghai to Helsinki looking after the cargo instead of passengers this time. @FinnairCargo #cargo #finnaircargo https://t.co/MLqkQU4OYd

We understand that your travel plans can change due to the pandemic. data.text: The partnership ensures that our customers are provided a test certificate required by the destination country smoothly and in a timely manner: As our customer, you will get access to the testing service at a discounted price and a possibility to buy it with Finnair Plus points.

We have started co-operation with private Finnish healthcare service company @Terveystalo to offer our customers easy access to coronavirus testing prior to travel in Finland. Read more: https://t.co/BbHIDu4pKW https://t.co/v72kbXZKHw

data.text: Due to decreased demand, we will close Finnair Lounge in the Schengen side of Helsinki Airport as of 12 Oct 2020 until further notice. Also, Finnair Business Lounge and Platinum Wing in the non-Schengen side remains closed for now.

Your safety is our top priority, also when travelling during the coronavirus. We have taken numerous actions to ensure your health and safety on every step of the journey, and we continue to follow the situation and introduce new measures. Read more: https://t.co/HBv01hG6Io https://t.co/amzKsVxO9s

data.text: As of 19 Sep, leisure travel to Finland will also be possible from Cyprus, Iceland, Germany, Norway, Poland, and Sweden. There is no mandatory quarantine or testing for travellers from these countries on arrival. Read more from @OurFinland's article: https://t.co/fsdphq0K4N

We're proud to be a part of this initiative! @traveloneworld becomes the 1st global airline alliance to unite behind a common target to achieve #carbonneutrality: All member airlines have committed to net zero carbon emissions by 2050. https://t.co/iHDuaO0So1 https://t.co/nxL7X6dAH4

"Thanks to Covid-19, we’ll know what the climate impact of cutting flying dramatically is," says @Anne_Larilahti "We will also know the social impacts, from people losing their jobs to the economic and social peril due to international trade slowing down." https://t.co/lHWZBZQEMk

data.text: We are cutting down flights from our October traffic program and will fly only around 70-80 daily flights per day instead of the previously planned 200. We will communicate flight cancellations directly to affected customers. https://t.co/g5GFsd32xi https://t.co/fV0yqgLq5y

data.text: In August, Finnair carried 193,000 passengers, which is 85.8% less than in the corresponding period of 2019 but 32.9% more than in July 2020. The COVID-19 pandemic impact remained clearly visible in the August traffic figures, cargo demand still strong. https://t.co/F2l7GtLjFX

data.text: OH-LWR will soon start her journey towards HEL. She was supposed to arrive already this spring, but we were able to delay the delivery. She will now join the rest of our fleet that is mostly parked and waiting for better times. May they arrive soon! https://t.co/5m0P1XeOgE
Tough, unpredictable times call for sisu. In Finland, we have a concept of sisu. Read more about what is sisu: https://t.co/bkysoViQy0. #sisu #InThisTogether https://t.co/E9MHGis7Kz

urls.title: The sisu within you: The Finnish key to life, love and success - thisisFINLAND
urls.description: Finnish sisu is so simple and straightforward that sometimes it takes a whole book to explain it.
